Name: Onuris
Description: This small bronze figurine, of average manufacture, comes from the excavations of F. Griffith at Kawa in 1933. It represents the god Onuris brandishing a lance. The god of This, whose name signifies "The one who brings back the Distant One", is dressed in a long robe down to the ankles and wears four straight feathers anda uraeus on his head. He is considered as a god of war annihilating particularly the enemies of the sun. The piece dates from the 25th Dynasty.
